subject: Vulnerability with the Post SMTP plugin
preview: Hello Andy, We are writing to you today to notify you about a security vulnerability  discovered in the *Post SMTP* plugin. We detected the plugin on one or more of your websites:  • csgdalligatorco

action.text: Manuel Lito Manceli marked as Closed
Workflow **Vulnerability assigned to Manuel** was triggered

full_threads.body:
Hello Andy, We are writing to you today to notify you about a security
vulnerability
<https://u9019290.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.6QPP-2FqJt5LKc0sK5s9FWukL6eYjGRlUZGKIx7PMBk851PjHny49wykLdo-2Fs-2BnzJH37jgWfa-2ByhUDoKGzWs6m5g1rsLpN0E7XmP82vk1UPH4-3DaCmH_tre2UAHwEmECmL-2B5jr3qwRPQT9rQca20tnmpMgYY87d8dsTVgiu582TDacMtLJTub5p9q9vwig2RIk0uFVyzzVstkzt-2Bqamcbyn-2BtjBCfZNPM0Tc17FCcjbg093PE50iTLf-2Fqd5hJSIm1kX6PLq69ySA5P2V8eJAtuQSgKWQE3UxtCftiYAuy4vKTYDxKOdLrTRCEUNb8INWgKm461J0tCRR9kwS3ptbxqtyg1JMA7bX2RhMWQzNg-2FrIvo-2FerfIg>
discovered in the *Post SMTP* plugin. We detected the plugin on one or more
of your websites:

• csgdalligatorcomau
• murrayzircon
• thermacellbackup

*You can ignore this message if you have already updated Post SMTP to the
latest version or have it set to update automatically.*

The plugin has a vulnerability that makes it possible for authenticated
admin users to perform SQL injection
<https://u9019290.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.6QPP-2FqJt5LKc0sK5s9FWusCgiFMU6Fk5Q83U6Bsa0iCAtYxZqekYxAciEFQZTX7UTQUdshxKnLgV49CTGBH6Jg-3D-3DRA5E_tre2UAHwEmECmL-2B5jr3qwRPQT9rQca20tnmpMgYY87d8dsTVgiu582TDacMtLJTulv0MBG-2F0z9lHI316M4UrbZaoK1oBx0vfCqLMqpCM-2BtJE8lwsYyPb7vH0Cjv8clZ3q-2FGoHtYI7qu2i6nkmphqw9hKbPWY7QV3aPQHmwN73H3TCSCVxTzXozx804e81cNnYoe6-2FZPHBd0CG1-2FVNaEiJ0GnpACLd87POWANn-2F3DySMEDZoWVwz9htPve5P-2FWG4l>.


*We report administrator-level vulnerabilities because many sites have
multiple administrators. But even if you're the only administrator of your
site, we still recommend updating the plugin.*

This vulnerability affects versions before 3.1.3. We recommend updating
this plugin immediately to the latest version. To update, log in to MyKinsta
<https://u9019290.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.6QPP-2FqJt5LKc0sK5s9FWuqfnKhH4mQmF-2FbsgKxDIHqo-3D5Ogi_tre2UAHwEmECmL-2B5jr3qwRPQT9rQca20tnmpMgYY87d8dsTVgiu582TDacMtLJTuYpB-2Bzp7GI9820GzWpE3zxjHuQKDvWFJ9G1TE7Y46xLYGoU17WBvkByOkz7vugAbAnwgbgaXXWq1tPHTo-2BnlKX5LVeo3Tw0BI97JK7MlltcZVOyjvsFuWCc7z0pJA1MaHuv-2FZgI1RY0n1bdCEHie5uXYrm4y458MvzREwoRiPvD8ERmuRHCtNtKffdYkrOUAf>
and go to WordPress sites > *site name* > Plugins and themes > Installed
plugins > Post SMTP, and click the "Update" button.

To check all sites in your account for plugin updates, go to "WordPress
sites" and click the "Plugins" tab. That will list all the plugins
installed across all of your sites. A number greater than zero in the
"Updates" column means an update is available. (There's also a "Themes" tab
allowing you to update all themes installed on your sites.)

We detected this vulnerability on March 12th, 2025, at 12:23 PM UTC, but
due to the time difference between scanning for vulnerabilities and sending
notifications, you may have already updated the plugin.

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to contact our support team.

Thank you for being a Kinsta client!


ID: post-smtp


The Kinsta Team
